Blog.post: urlLink I used this picture of a White Bengal Tiger for reference. Isn't he beautiful?
urlLink We start here with a blob of paint. I used acrylic paint for the stripes.
urlLink Dip brush in water.
urlLink Dip wet brush in paint.
urlLink Clear away excess paint if there's too much on the brush.
urlLink Make sure that the paint is just right. Not too thick or thin.
urlLink Draw in the outines for the stripes.
urlLink Color the stripes
urlLink Simple stripe done.
urlLink There an example. More pictures urlLink here .

urlLink Grrrr.... Finally onto the camouflage, adding in the tiger stripes. This will take longer than I expected as it took me one whole night of painting just to finish the head unit. I think it would take longer if I intend to mask and airbrush.
More updates and progress on my urlLink model. Some pictures are posted below.
urlLink I have the power in the grasp of my hand!
urlLink Eck! A "mouse"!
urlLink Near Monitor.
urlLink Where the hell is my leg!?
urlLink "A penny for the crippled?"
urlLink One more leg to go.
urlLink Kampfer bust. What i've managed to come up with so far. More pictures below and urlLink here .
urlLink Shoulder Pre-shaded the left shoulder. Damage on shoulder is done using a routing tool.
urlLink Kampfer Head

urlLink Chest armor half done using pre-shading method. Pre-shading means painting on the shadows first, I used dark grey as a pre-shade coat. Lastly, off white is painted in gradually to achieve the effect desired.
urlLink Kampfer Bust

urlLink MS-18E Kampfer My current project at the moment, painting the above mobile suit known commonly as the "Kampfer" or translated "Champion" or "Fighter" in german. More information about the suit can be found urlLink here .

An exaggerated sms message i received one day: "Oh!!! Luk at mi!!! Mi iz very guds at wrting shrthand. Mi tink iz so KuTe tat it wil impress the boyz wif tis kind of shrthand sms msg. "OOoooOOOh Oh Oh!!! Lotsa luv and mi miz U 2....!!" ^_^ Can you understand such crap? Makes you wonder why we spend a quarter of our life in school. I used to think that spelling was such a waste of time, well it looks that way now does it?

I wonder how many people realize that once a person comes out from his or her mother's vagina, we inherently have our ass owned. Like bulls being tagged with a scorching iron label showing that it belongs to a cattle owner, likewise, we have this invisible "I own your ass" label tagged on us.
I guess i've got to start somewhere, there my very first post.
